inn1.comm: Two slips in place. almost yorker-length first-up and it swings away. The batsman tries to jab it away but it curves away. No ball, though.
slips in the slower one, full in length, he goes for the big slog across the line but is beaten by the lack of pace and ends up dragging it towards midwicket

length delivery that straightens - perhaps cuts away a bit -  does the trick. It landed on a length around middle and leg and shaped away a touch. Guptill was looking to work it to the on side and was surprised by the away movement. The ball flew of the leading edge to backward point. Pouched! 100th ODI wicket! Nice little moment
on the leg stump line this time, flicked past square-leg
gets forward to defend to the covers
fuller and straighter, pushed towards mid-on
in the zone outside off stump, left alone
He starts off with an inswinger. As always. Taylor gets back and across to push it to the off side
gets forward to push the nip-backer to covers
Taylor is walking across and ending up almost outside off. And so Kulasekara hurls this further outside off and also, gets it to straighten. Taylor is beaten. searching for it
gets right across the sticks, tries to work the length delivery from well outside off through midwicket and  is hit on the pad. Shout for lbw but that struck him well outside off stump
works this to the on side.
in the zone outside off stump and the batsman pushes at it and Sanga collects
slings it well outside off stump, Sanga collects
Top shot! He glided forward to punch the length delivery sweetly through covers.
full in length, around middle and off line, squeezed out to point
in the channel outside off stump, left alone
lands around the off stump line and cuts away, left alone
just outside off stump and the batsman has a poke at it. Almost fatal.
Edged to third man It was the length delivery that straightened outside off and Watling had a tentative poke at it
Fab delivery again. This one cut back in sharply from well outside off stump and hit the pad high.
moves in the air and Taylor leans across to defend to covers
another top delivery. Super start from Kula. In and out. This one straightens outside off and Taylor searches for it and is beaten
gets forward to push it towards mid-off for a quick single
fullish delivery around off stump, steered to point
lands around the off stump line and curves away, left alone

ooh .. fine delivery. This one was full again but started from the middle and leg and curve towards the middle and off. Taylor was in danger of getting squared-up but adjusts to defend it to the off side
in the channel outside off stump, left alone
length delivery just outside off stump, pushed out to covers
in the zone outside off stump, left alone
in the channel outside off stump, left alone
Lovely incutter! This one lands well outside off and cuts in sharply. Again moves past the prod and again hits him high on the pad
Thump! Taylor glides forward and punches this - it was the one that straightened outside off- and over Kula! It was smashed on the up
leans forward to defend the length delivery to mid-off
around the off stump line, pushed out to mid-on
in the zone outside off stump, Taylor jabs it down to third man
this one shapes in and it has been defended back down the track
length delivery around the off stump, defended to the off side
full in length and straightening outside off stump, Taylor drives straight to covers
moves forward to push the length delivery towards mid-off
around the off stump line, Taylor stretches forward to defend
lifts this length delivery over cover point. He didn't quite time that well but clears the in-field
This time, he goes over the on side. He picked the length delivery from around off stump and dragged it over wide midwicket
back of length around off stump line, tapped to covers
short in length outside off stump and Watling punches it on the up through point
Another shout for lbw. Again too high and perhaps even outside off. It was another sharp inc utter and it him in line of the off stump this but again high. Hawk eye says it would kissed the bails.
full in length outside off stump, stabbed of the inner edge to the leg side
in the channel outside off stump, left alone
around the off stump line, steered past backward point
Crack! Short and bit of width on offer and Watling cuts him to the point boundary
Loverly square drive! This time, Angelo hurled it fuller and got some shape away but Watling leaned across to square drive it neatly through point.
similar delivery but Watling is late in coming forward, in fact ends up lunging forward to drive to covers
on the middle stump line, dabbed to the on side
around the off stump line, defended back down the pitch
around the middle stump line, carefully pushed to the on side
The keeper is standing up to the stumps. The front leg is, as ever, pushed across and he then brings his bat around to deflect it to backward square-leg
cuts in from outside off stump, Watling stabs it of the inner edge to the on side
fullish outside off stump, off driven to mid-off

Direct hit from Kapu but overthrows It was pushed to right of backward point ...and Taylor pushed for the run. Kapu charges across and fires a direct hit at the non-striker's stumps but Taylor dived back in time.  It ricochets off the stumps.
leans forward to defend the length delivery
Whack! Kulasekara tries the bouncer and Watling pulls it over square-leg

Dead plumb! That tendency to push that front leg across has done him in. It was a length delivery that moved in towards the middle stump. Taylor, as he often does, pushed the front leg across and then tried to get the bat around the front pad. Too late. Trapped!
full in length around off stump, leans forward to drive to mid-off

Two ducks in a row. Oh dear. He can take heart from a Sri Lankan batsman who went on to become the captain - Marvan Atapattu. This one was full and outside off stump and Kane Williamson went for the drive. The shift to the front foot wasn't quick enough, the weight transfer wasn't smooth and he ended up chasing it a bit and edged it to left of first slip where a good lunging catch has been taken. He shakes his head in disappointment as he walks away.
beaten first-up. It cut in from outside off and Scott Styris stabbed at it and left a big bat and pad gap. The ball went through it
gets right behind the line of this and pushes it to the off
in the zone outside off stump, left alone
sprays this one down the leg side
just outside off stump, punched to mid-off
cuts in from outside off stump and Watling gets right behind it to defend
around the off stump line, pushed back to the bowler
yet another one the cuts back in, worked past square-leg
short in length outside off, punched on the up to mid-ff
edged clear of the lone slip. It was the short-of-length delivery that straightened outside off and Styris tried to drive on the up and edged it well to the right of Samaraweera
overpitched delivery on the middle, tapped towards mid-on
leans forward to defend the length deliver. Styris walks across to have a chat
Fab! He glided forward to punch the length delivery on the up. And straight back down the track. Angelo dived. Styris dived back. And the mid-on fielder Malinga dived. The ball raced away
around the off stump line, pushed to point
gets across to steer this to point again
around the off stump line, defended towards covers
leans forward to square drive past point
around the off stump, jabbed away to the off
pushes this one away for a single
just outside the off stump, leans across to defend to the off side
lands on a length outside off, some width on offer, punched away to sweeper cover
googly on the middle and leg line, turns past the poke to hit the pad
around the off stump line, pushed out to mid-off
straightens outside off stump and it has been left alone
gets across to punch the length delivery straight to covers
back of length and well outside off, slashed away wide of third man for couple of runs
gets forward and across to defend a length delivery
on the middle stump line, eased to mid-on
googly on the middle, tapped to the on side
gets forward to on drive the googly down to long-on
full in length and just outside off stump, driven to sweeper cover
leans across to defend yet another wrong'un.
on the middle and leg line, driven down to long-on
lands just outside off, tilts in a touch, defended on the front foot
around the off stump line, pushed to cover point
goes for the yorker but slips in a full toss down the leg side. Sanga dives.
sharp lifter on the middle and leg, Styris, it appears, picked it late but managed to duck in time
really full delivery, stabebd back down the track
slower, on a length, on the middle, clipped through midwicket. Styris ran almost in circles there!
really full delivery, driven crisply back to Malinga who fires the throw back
nice slow loopy dipping full toss, Styris does well to read it and wrist it behind square-leg
leans forward to work this to midwicket
on the middle stump line, Watling brings the bat in front of the pad to square-leg
just outside off stump, steered to backward point
just outside off stump, guides it to point
around the off and middle line, tapped to covers
carrom ball that cuts away from the middle, Styris adjusts, opens the bat-face and guides it past point
slightly short in length, cut away to deep point

lovely spinning delivery that dipped and turned. Watling was on the lunge and beaten as he shaped for the drive. Sanga removed the bails and asked the question. Watling had his back foot inside the crease.
oooh  he shuffled across to defend it with soft hands. Too soft! The ball back spun past his legs but rolled past the off stump!
leans forward to unfurl the off drive for a single
gets forward to ping long-off
around the pads, rolls away
gets well forward and across to drive it through extra covers. Neatly done.
the googly again, slower, bit more air, driven down to long-on
Edged to third man boundary. It was the carrom ball cutting away and Watling went for the cover drive. Edged wide of slip
short in length, gets right back and across to clip it to deep square-leg region
on the off stump line, pushed back to the bowler
lands this one on a length around off, driven on the front foot
plays the paddle sweep to rotate the strike
leans across to drive to sweeper cover
flighted around off stump, driven to long-off
around the off stump line, defended on the front foot
fifty on debut! Up in style as well! He leaned forward to smoke this flighted delivery to the straight boundary. One bounce and over the ropes! Fab strike. Great start by Watling.
gets forward to push it to covers
on the middle stump line, tapped to midwicket
around the off stump, cuts away a bit, pushed through point
googly that breaks back in from outside off, Watling goes back to defend
Another googly, he tries to jab it to the on side and is struck on the pad outside off stump
cuts towards off, punched down to long-on
leans forward to drive the carrom ball to long-on
gets forward to play the paddle sweep
slip and short mid-off in and Watling drives this to sweeper cover

Important strike by Rangana. Nicely flighted loopy delivery that turns away from the off stump and Styris edges the intended cover drive. Yet another catch by Mahela at first slip. Herath is delighted.
on the middle stump line, driven towards deep cover for a single
the carrom ball from Herath, outside off stump and short in length, punched away to sweeper cover
flighted around off stump, full, driven to covers

And he is gone now. Jinx and stuff, if you are one of those who believe in them. It was the surprise bouncer from Angelo and Watling tried to pull it from outside off stump. But he could only top edge it straight up and Sanga moved to his left to take a dolly. Fine knock but it's over now.
full in length, homing in on the off stump, pushed to the on side of the pitch
short in length just outside off stump, punched to deep cover
taps this to midwicket for a single.
gets forward to push this to the covers
Angelo gets greedy: he tries another bouncer outside off. Left alone this time!
gets forward to push the really full delivery to covers
ooh! He shuffled across and then tried to defend but was beaten by the turn and the bounce. It landed on the middle and off line and spun past the edge!
similar line, pushed, with the turn, to the off side
plays the sweep shot to pick some runs
on the middle stump line, loopy delivery that dips, tapped close on the leg side and they rush across. Sanga whips off his gloves, and fires the throw at the non-striker's end but misses
leans well forward to defend this to the off side

almost run out . It was the slower one, jabbed close on the leg side and he sets off for the run. Angelo crosses the pitch and rushes forward, picks up the ball and dives forward to flick the throw. Nathan too dived back. The throw missed the stumps and Angelo slaps the ground in frustration
slips this wide down the leg side
well outside off stump this time, left alone
walks couple of steps down the track and drives to right of mid-on. It's a direct hit from Mahela but he is home in time
the slower one, around off stump line, defended on the front foot
length delivery outside off stump, Hopkins lunges forward to edge the off drive to midwicket
gets forward to present the full bat-face in defense
leans well forward to defend to the off side
gets back to work it to midwicket region
The carrom ball, fuller and outside off  stump line. pushed to the off side.
flighted outside off stump line, driven to deep cover
on the middle and leg, swept to deep backward square-leg
around the off stump line, leans forward to defend
length delivery around the off stump line, defended on the front foot
on the middle stump line, tapped to the on side
length delivery that cuts in to the middle and off line, defended to the off side
the bouncer just outside off stump and Sanga collects.
on the pads, turned behind the square-leg
slower one, on the middle, turned to midwicket
turns from the middle stump line, squeezed to backward point
leans forward to drive to covers
on the middle stump line, pushed wide of mid-on
quicker, around off, full, shuffles across to defend down the track
that carrom ball from outside off stump, punched to the off side
spins away from the off and middle, pushed to the off side
low full toss on the pads, clipped away for a single
yorker on the middle and off line, stabbed of the inner edge to the leg side
dipping low full toss, jabbed to the on side
banged in short, rears up chest-high, McCulum arched back to fend it away behind the wicket on the off side
another bouncer, this time higher, Wide

Was it a catch or a bump? They refer to the upstairs. Clean catch! The slow loopy dipping full delivery does the trick. Hopkins lunges forward, gets surprised by not only the lack of pace but how rapidly it dipped on him and ended up slicing it to point. Clean catch. It went straight of the bat. It bounced before it hit the bat but not after

Clatter! Yorked! Full, pacy, straight. Gone! The bat came down late, the ball whooshed under it. Save the foot campaign was on there! It was on the leg stump and Tuffey made sure his foot didn't come in the way!
around the off stump line, pushed to point
on the middle stump line, turned to the on side
fetches the full delivery from outside off and sweeps
drifts in, lands on middle and turns, pushed to the off side. Two slips in
gets forward to jab it to the off side
around the off and middle stump line, tapped to left of Dilshan at silly point
tries the slower one, beats the batsman but the ball shaves past the outside edge
another slower one, full, driven to mid-off
fullish and well outside off, swing and a miss
bouncer on the middle stump line, he ducks under
fullish, around off, pushed to mid-off
yorker length around the off stump, dug out to the off side
loopy delivery around the off stump, pushed to covers
goes back to punch to sweeper cover
fetches it from well outside off, took it on the full as well and swept it away
gets forward to tap this to the on side for a single. herath fires a direct hit at the non-striker's end
full delivery around off stump, pushed back to the bowler
around the off stump line, defended on the front foot
full in length on the middle stump line, tapped to the on side
low full toss on the legs, attempted yorker of course, and it has been whipped away through to the midwicket boundary. How will Malinga respond? Yorker? Bouncer? Slower one? I am going for bouncer
It's a bouncer and Mills manages to sway away
another short ball, into the rib cage this time, tucked behind square-leg
bouncer outside off stump, goes for the pull but can't connect
short in length around the middle and off, defended to the off
flighted around the off stump, tapped to the off side
around the off stump line, defended on the front foot
well outside off this time, left alone
gets back to squeeze this to backward point
on the middle stump line, turned down to fine-leg region
gets back to clip it behind square-leg
stretches forward to push it to the on side and the ball rolls of the pad
cuts away from the off stump, jabbed to the on side
around the off stump, pushed wide of covers for a single
carrom ball that cuts away quickly from the off stump line, Mills pokes at it and the ball rushes past the edge
squeezes this carrom ball to backward point
leans forward to work it to the on side
leans forward to defend to the off side
on the middle stump line,defended to the off side
drives this full delivery to covers
flighted delivery lands on the middle and leg and turns. Mills went for the big hit to the on side and got the leading edge and the long-off fielder ran in to pouch a simple catch.
fullish, on the pads, turned down to fine-leg region
slower one, short in length and outside off stump, steered to backward point
leans across to drive to backward point
the bouncer this time .. too high and Dharmasena extends his arms
another lifting delivery, McCullum allows it to fly past his head
slower one around off, pushed well to the right of backward point where Kapugedera makes a fine diving save and has a shy at the stumps
low dipping full toss on the middle and leg, turned through midwicket
slower one, full, pushed through mid-on for a single
around the off stump, cutting away, carefully pushed back to Mendis
Thump! Nathan charges down the track and crashes this over long-on. Wham!
pushes this wide outside leg stump ... Malinga makes a diving tumbling save .. he nearly kicked it to the boundary before he recovered and threw in a dive
goes for the cut but the carrom ball whooshes past the edge

shout for lbw. It was the googly that landed on the middle stump line and it hit the pad just above the knee roll. Saved by the height? The hawk eye says it would have clipped the top of the leg stump
gets forward to defend to the on side
clips this one to square-leg
full and well outside off stump, Sanga gathers
full in length around off stump line, pushed back to the bowler
full again, driven to short extra cover
cuts in from outside off stump, Southee edges it to his pad and it rolls behind the wicket on the off side
gets forward to punch it to long-on for a single
fullish, around off stump, pushed out towards mid-off
around the off stump line, defended to covers
on the leg stump line, tapped past square-leg for a single, they think about the second but Malinga comes charging in
cuts away from the off stump, Southee is beaten, pushing inside the line of the carrom ball
around the off stump line, defended on the front foot
The carrom ball goes past the outside edge. Again.
fuller and he leans forward to drive to long-on
slower one on the pads, rolls away for a leg bye
cuts in from outside off, pushed back to the bowler
slower one well outside off but he fetches it from there and swats it through midwicket
moves down the track, takes it on the full and drives past the bowler. Malinga moves to his right at mid-off and dives and ends up deflecting it towards Mahela at long-on
yet another slow off cutter, whipped through midwicket
shout for lbw .. length delivery around off stump line, tries to swing it across the line and it rolls away to the short fine-leg region
pushes outside the line of the delivery and Sanga collects
cuts away from the off stump, steered to backward point
moves down the track but Mendis shortens the length; its pushed to midwicket
carrom ball that cuts away sharply from the off stump line, goes past the edge and Sanga collects
this one cuts from the middle and leg line and Mccullum tries to work it to the on side and gets a leading edge/. The ball is in the air but it doesn't carry to Mendis
taps this to point for a single
rushes down the track, Mendis bangs it in short and he top edges it to third man
full pitched on the off stump line, driven to covers
on the middle stump line, slower one, tapped to midwicket
the slow bouncer around off, chopped towards Sanga
slow off cutter, steered to point for a single
gets forward to drive to long-on
on the middle, cuts away, flicked to backward square-leg
googly on the middle stump, tapped towards midwicket
moves down the track and punches it to extra cover
Nathan falls after a responsible hand. He went down on his knee and ended up slicing  it high towards mid-off.
skids towards off stump, jabs the pull shot to the on side
full in length, bounds off the pad to short-leg
slower one outside off, goes past the waft and bounces in front of Sanga who is unable to collect it cleanly
yorker arrives on the leg stump line, dug out to on side for a quick single
the slower one, Southee is too early with his shot and edges it to gully
fullish, on the leg stump line, edges it towards gully
slings across a full delivery , it goes past the waft and goes right between the batsman's legs! Sanga dives but is unable to reach
fast yorker this time, just about dug out .. it runs of the inner edge
yorker length just outside off, moves past the bat and goes to Sanga
tries the slower one, smashed hard but straight to long-on
yorker length on the middle, pushed out to covers
slower one outside off stump, run down to third man
fullish, driven to long-on
steered through point for a single
fullish and outside leg stump, goes past the waft to the keeper
full again, straighter, pushed out to covers
fullish, on the pads, flicked past square-leg
slower one outside off, tapped to backward point
moves outside leg stump, Malinga slings a yorker and he just about manages to dig it out in time.
fullish outside off stump, pushed towards covers
He goes for the big hit but drags the slower one to Dilshan at deep square-leg region

inn2.comm: hint of inward movement to start off, shaped in from middle and off, driven firmly to the right of mid off, where Williamson does well to tumble and save
Dilshan! Short ball directed reasonably well at Dilshan, but not enough pace, Dilshan latches on with a murderous pull and keeps it in front of square. Couple of bounces into the fence
goes for a hoick to the leg side this time and does not connect.. angled in from middle stump, short and finished on his hips, but he missed the slap-flick-pull
more like it from Mills, hits the seam and spits up from just behind a length, shade of away movement as well and Dilshan lets it go
bonus ball, over-pitched on the pads and Dilshan won't be thrilled that he flicked straight to midwicket
Dilshan was probably expecting another bouncer, but this was on the McGrath length outside off and nipped back in. Dilshan saw it and opened the face, from the crease, towards point

ah, short and not too wide outside off and for a moment there, Tharanga looked just like the man he has replaced in this side - Sanath Jayasuriya. No room to cut, but he created the power and flexed his muscles to send it fine towards third man in a trice
good ball, jumps up from a length on leg stump and Tharanga takes his top hand off as it spits up
gets bat on this one, it is slightly fuller and it is neatly glanced for a single
good ball, that's the area. On the corridor outside off and nipping back in. Dilshan is not forward or back and pokes out to the offside
slightly straighter and more movement, so it ends on Dilshan's pads but he does not have the length to play the flick. Tapped off the pads to midwicket

another one on the money, straightening from off stump this time and Dilshan opens the face to run it behind point. Tuffey's first over negotiated without loss,.. the man has a Swannish tendency to strike early, so well done Sri Lanka.

wicket! Mills has taken the swirling, curling, missile on its return to the earth! That was a length ball on Dilshan's middle and leg, he was a little early on the flick and he ended up getting the most healthy of top-edges.. that took off, it crossed the stratosphere.. it broke into free space, and then lost its momentum and decided to return to our planet.. Mills on his follow through waited.. and waited.. A few more fielders converged, but Mills was the chosen one.. and he pouched it, tumbling away on the pitch. Big wicket!
tapped from outside off towards the off side
straighter, on middle and leg and he plays it back to the bowler
fuller on leg stump and Tharanga gets well behind it to play it back to the bowler
back of a length outside off, Tharanga gets behind the line and defends to the off side

super over this from Mills, he has been on the money every single ball. Another back of a length delivery angling across from leg towards middle. No room, no length for Tharanga and he quietly defends to the off side
Sanga leaves his first ball outside off as it sails past
ooh, pitched up, inviting the drive and Sanga a little late on the move as he looked to on-drive. Got the leading edge down to third man.
WHACK! Over-pitched outside off and Tharanga backed himself to crack it through the covers. Watling at cover took off to his right, but the laws of physics denied him the chance to stop it. Four
drives to McCullum at point. Good fielding too
ah, late decision to leave the short lifter outside off, but the ball still hit the bat as he was withdrawing it.. goes safely to the off side
back of a length on leg stump, he is caught on the crease but manages to keep it out to the offside
short and pushing the batsman back on the crease, this is good stuff from Tuffey, he has Tharanga hopping incomfortably
slips down the leg this time and its a wide
Jaffa! That took off menacingly outside off, Tharanga was reading for the cut and suddenly the ball had rises close to shoulder high and he just about kept it down
over-pitched on leg, the sucker ball, and Tharanga is up to it. Drives down towards mid off for one
short and wide outside off, Sanga wants nothing to do with it
back of a length on Sanga's pads and he taps it behind square for one

fantastic bowling this! Another peach from Mills, that landed in line with middle and off, and moved away partly with the angle, and partly off the seam, leaving Tharanga embarassed as he missed the off drive by a margin.
nifty running. That was back of a length outside off and bouncing, Sanga rode the bounce and tapped it with soft hands to the off side and took off at great speed for one
whoa, uneven bounce now, that kept real low and Tharanga had to come down in a hurry to keep it out. Would have been gone if that hit his pads as it came in from middle and off
short and wide outside off, Tharanga does a Jayasuriya again, flashing hard outside off, but only the master of the flayed cut could have connected with that

classy! That was more Ganguly than Jayasuriya. It was on a length outside off and Tharanga leant without really moving front and from there it was all timing and placement. Satiny elegance as it purred past covers
ooh, that kicked up from leg stump and Tharanga was in a spot as he looked to play it to leg side and got a leading edge to the off side
back of a length on leg stump, Sanga stays back and works it off the hips towards mid on.. Thinks of a single and decides against it
sucker-ball thrown well wide outside off and pitched well up. Sanga was late coming forward into the cover drive and got a thick inside edge towards mid on.. Hmm..
gets the outside edge this time, again bowled well outside off and he got it down to third man for one
ooh, this one gets big on him from middle and leg as he shapes to play it off the back foot. The batsmen need to be a little tighter here.
And finishes another over with another jaffer! Mills lands it on leg stump and gets it to dart across outside off as the batsman pokes without much conviction. Misses it Completely
beaten outside off. Thanks to Ten Sports who are more eager with their ads than with the action, we could not quite see what happened there.
shot, overpitched outside off and Sanga goes down on a knee to tonk it over the covers for three
replies with a focused bouncer aimed on leg stump line and Tharanga quickly gets under it
length ball outside off, Tharanga is not moving forward very fluently and plays from the crease to point.
nice little slower ball, off cutter at 112 kph, on off stump, but Tharanga is up to it, leaning out to defend to the off side
length ball on off to finish off, Tharanga looks to off-drive and does not time it at all
half volley on leg stump, punched straight back to mid on
again over-pitched on off and going away, the batsman leans out and lets it go.
ooh, Sanga looks to trot out of the crease and whack it but the length is short and he can't time it. Inside edged to the leg side
short ball, rises prodigiously outside off and Sanga decides to shoulder arms as it passes
short ball, banged in from round the sticks, but not much pace, so Sangakkara easily pulls it past the diving midwicket fieldsman for two
loses the line, this one ends outside leg with the angle and it is easily tucked behind square for runs
back of a length on the corridor and Tharanga is uncertain as he prods from the crease.. Hmm.. Inside edge runs to the l;eg side
short and wide outside off, Sanga moves back and well across but it is still too wide for the cut
length ball slightly wide outside off to have the batsman in doubts, he easily lets it go
short ball, Sanga gets into good position but can't elude fine leg with the pull.
that's a really bad ball and it has got the treatment. Short and wide outside off, Tharanga reached out and extended the arms to cut it high over the cover cordon

Smashed! Tharanga is showing the entire3 gamut of batting today, from looking clueless to playing some classy shots. That was again wide outside off, not too short.. Not much footwork from Tharanga, he just steadied himself and swung his bat in a smooth arc sending it crashing through the covers
bouncer to finish off, he gets under it and lets it go
over-pitched on the middle and leg line, leans forward and plays it back to the bowler
more prodigious movement.. Landed on leg and curved away wide outside off as the batsman shouldered arms
tapped from leg-stump line, off the backfoot towards short midwicket. They think of a single, but the fielder pounces on it with intent. No run.
that's the length, Sanga can't come forward, and he has no room to cross-bat either, so he can only tap it back without momentum to the off side
another stolen single.. Length ball on off stump, tapped with hands as soft as a powder puff to mid off and they scurry across
finishes with a back of length ball on leg stump and it is defended down the track to the bowler

shot! Sanga flows into that straight drive like a serene river, no ripples no nothing.. Over-pitched on leg stump yes, he got nicely under it and went through with the loft and sent it flying over mid on
good ball, shortens the length and opens up Sanga with a touch of away movement and gets the outside edge.. It does not carry to the cordon though
back of a length again, Sanga stays back and plays it to the off side
really short bouncer, not too far from being called a wide.. Almost went out of the TV frame on its upward trajectory that, Sanga ducked under it.. He did not have to
again back of a length, you can see Sanga wants to play off front foot, but this was not full enough. He was forced to play it off the back foot to mid off

ooh, another stolen single, but they were almost caught red-handed! Tapped softly straight to Williamson off the front foot, and he took off quickly. Williamson did his best but missed the stumps as Sanga dived in
and Sanga greets him wiyth an expansive, on the knee cover drive. It was not  too full, but Sanga is eager to create momentum by getting forward and lofts this with the arms through the covers
poor ball, overcompensates and lands this on middle, and it darts down the leg. Sanga wait and clips it square for four more
driven to mid off, can't get the gap
up and away, upper cuts it outside off, but finds sweeper cover
pushed back with the length, on off stump, and Tharanga shows the full face to defend down the pitch
good bouncer to finish off, Tharanga just about yanked his head away in time as it screamed past him
short and asking to be smashed, Sanga gets into position and pulls it well, but there is cover at long leg
good ball, gets a hint of away movement from middle and off, Tharanga is stuck on the backfoot stabbing at it and can't connect
strays on the pads this time and Tharanga glances it round the corner for one
over-pitched outside off and driven square, straight to point
short ball, bounces alarmingly but the line is wrong.. Slips for a wide down the leg
another short ball, Sanga clims on to it and rolls the wrists to keep it down to square leg
another one of those, exploding from a length on off stump.. Goes past safely as the batsman looks to fend at it
length ball on off stump and drives into the off side but finds the fielder
Lock, stock and two smoking barrels! Sanga punches the length ball back at thrice the pace it came and McKay had to take evasive action as it whizzed past in a hurry to the straight boundary
opens the face and steers it between point and cover for a single
pulled away majestically! These two have weathered the storm and are cashing in now. Not the cleverest ball, short and straying well down the leg, Tharanga did not have much to do except redirect it.
this one is on off stump line and short, Tharanga leans back and opens the face to run it down to third man
a burst of pace to finish the over, 141 kph, Sanga was late on the flick and it hit his pads after getting an inside edge onto the leg side for one.
One slip in place. He watches Sanga let go this length delivery through to the keeper
short in length, on the hips, tucked to deep backward square-leg
back of length, on the middle stump line, pushed to the off side
shortish, sits up just outside off, swatted to deepish square-leg, placed there for an edged or mistimed pull

Whoa! what an effort from Tuffey. Sanga leaned forward to drive on the up and well to the left of mid-off where Tuffey makes a valiant effort to catch it. He even gets his finger tips on it. Full-stretched dive. Don't tell me that was a chance. No please don't. Seriously don't.
pushes this one for a single
one slip in place and Sanga steers this off break to backward point
on the middle and leg, defended back to the bowler
flighted from round the stumps, lands on middle and leg, squeezed out to the off side . Some turn and bounce. No one at silly-point though
drags this short of length, punched uppishly but short of short extra cover
quicker, on the legs, turned around the corner past the tuck-shop for a single
around the off stump line, defended on the front foot
flighted outside the leg stump, Sanga tries to fine-sweep but misses
Another wide down the leg side. Hmmm
leans forward to drive to covers
he loves bowling outside leg, this time Sanga connects with the sweep shot
tossed up outside off, Sanga goes down on his knee to drive to right of long-off
flighted just outside off, defended towards covers
Byes Big turn!  It was flighted full outside off stump and Sanga went for the cover drive. He missed. The ball missed the edge. And it turns between the keeper and the slip fielder
gets forward to defend to the off
leans forward to defend to the off
pushed outside the line and edged it back down the track
around the off and middle line, turned to the on side
leans forward to ease it to long-off
lands outside off stump and goes on straight, left alone
fullish around off, square driven to deep point.
gets forward to defend to the off side
leans across to drive to covers
around the off stump line, pushed to the off-side of the pitch
short in length, on the middle and leg, turned down fine-leg region
Guptill takes a stunner at short extra cover. Absolute P E A C H. He flew. It was driven low and well to the right of him and he flew with his right hand stretched out. A you tube moment!
tossed on the middle and off, driven to right of Nathan who makes a diving stop
Whippity whip! He glided forward, got to the pitch of the flighted delivery and whipped it between the bowler and mid-on
around the off stump, pushed through to deep cover
turns in from outside off, clipped past square-leg
around the off stump line, pushed to right of short cover
whiplash! It was just outside off stump and Tharanga pressed back and slashed it through gully
tip and run. It was pushed to left of short cover and off they went
leans across to defend to the off
ooh! It landed on a length on the middle and off and cut away sharply. Tharanga was beaten, going for a loose drive
around the off stump line, pushed to the off
full in length and outside off, square driven through point
full in length around off stump line, jabbed to the on side
Dropped by Styris at first slip. Tharanga shaped to defend and it edged to right of Styris who stretched his hand out but couldn't hold on. Mahela would have pouched that
leans forward to defend to the off side
gets on the front foot to nudge it away
gets forward to push it away for a single
gets across to push it to covers
on the middle stump line, pushed to the off side
fullish, from round the stumps, squeezed out to cover point
short in length outside off, beaten on the cut
fullish outside off stump, driven towards sweeper cover
leans forward to work the full-length delivery to the on side
leans forward to nudge it to the on side
flighted from round the stumps, full around the off, driven back to the bowler
gets forward to ping long-off
gets across to shove this one away for a single
leans forward to defend  back down the track
gets forward to push it to the on side for a single
works this behind square-leg for a single
gets forward and across to push it defensively
gets behind the line of this length delivery and taps it to the on side
on the middle and off line, gently pushed back down the pitch
fullish, outside off stump, driven neatly to long-off
backs away to dab it to backward point
leans forward to on drive to long-on
rushes down the track and on drives to long-on
drags it short and Tharanga cuts to sweeper cover
Ah! So simple. So soft. It was flighted outside off stump and Mahela chipped it straight to short extra cover!
turns in from outside off, nudged to the on side

just outside the off stump, one of those partly steered, partly edged thingy. He played away from the body with an open bat-face and it ran between slip and backward point. Styris didn't like it and had a few things to say. Good old Scotty
leans across to drive to covers
short in length and outside off, goes for the cut but can't connect
length delivery on the middle, dabbed past square-leg
goes right back to defend it back down the track
leans forward to deflect it to midwicket
leans forward to drive to the covers
lunges forward to off drive and edges it to the on side
low full toss, swatted to deep midwicket
works this to deep backward square-leg region
turns away from the off stump, Tharanga pushes inside the line and the keeper gathers
leans forward to defend and is struck on the around the off stump. Very high on the pads, though.
fullish, loopy, curvy, driven to long-on
leans across to push the full-length delivery to point
full again, creamed to right of covers where Guptill makes another Guptillian stop
short in length, outside off, chopped to backward point
around the off stump line, defended to covers
full toss from round the stumps but Samaraweera drives straight to covers
fullish and outside off, Samaraweera flicks it to right of mid-on
kicks up from short of length, jabbed to gully
full in length and just outside off stump, Tharanga plays a neat square drive to deep-point region
length delivery outside off, mistimed to covers. Where Guptill prowls. Don't even think of a single
Chop! It was the shortish delivery outside off, chopped down to backward point
on the middle and off line, defended back down the track
leans forward to work the full delivery to the on side
really full delivery on the off and middle, driven towards the straight boundary
fullish outside off, square driven to cover point
fullish again, and Tharanga square drives it uppishly but wide of the diving Williamson at cover point
cuts away from the lunging Tharanga and Hopkins whips off the bails
from round the stumps, kicks up just outside off, pushed through point for a single
jabbed to wide midwicket region for a single.
fullish, on the pads, rolls down to short fine-leg region
kicks up from short of length outside off, guided past gully
around the off stump line, turned to the on side
gets forward to defend the length delivery
on the pads, tries to work it away for a single but doesn't connect properly
around the off stump line, steered to backward point
on the off-stump line, cutting away, pushed through to deep-point region
just outside off stump, dabs it to short third man
full, on the middle, the pad came across first, then the bat came around it and the ball rolls past midwicket
just outside off stump, dabbed to short third man
Flickity flick! It was the full-length delivery on the pads and he whipped it up and over square-leg.
short in length around off, Sam goes back and across to defend
slower one, on the middle and off, Samaraweera gave himself some room there but cuts straight to point
Carved! He backed away, waited for the slower one to arrive - it sat up from short of length- and he carved it up and over point
shuffles across to dab this to square-leg
on the pads, defended to the on side
backs away, the ball follows him and he tucks it towards square-leg
full in length outside off, Tharanga stays back and slices it towards long-off
shuffles across and the ball slips down the leg side
goes down the leg side and goes for the pull but the bouncer flies over his head
fullish, on the middle stump line, Samaraweera shuffles across and swat-flicks it up and over towards deep backward square-leg
climbs from short of length, Tharanga goes for the pull but the ball gets bigger on him and he mistimes the shot towards mid-on
moves outside leg stump and wants to clear the off-side field but doesn't connect properly .. the ball rolls to covers
Paddle scoop! He got outside the off stump and paddled the back-of-length delivery over the keeper! And he smiles as he walks across to have a chat with his partner
Caught at deep cover. It was the slower one, fullish outside off, and he ended up chipping it to Watling in the deep. Fine knock, though. He has done his job.
another slower attempted but this one slips down the leg side
short in length outside off, run down to short third man
gets forward to wrist the full delivery to wide mid-on

Caught or did it bounce just before Ross Taylor took it? Taylor is claiming it. Clean catch, too. The umpires have gone upstairs. It was flicked uppishly to right of short midwicket and Taylor dives to take it. Looks Dettol clean to me. Angelo has to go. Out for a duck.
full in length outside off stump, punched to point
shuffles to the off to tap it to the on side
short in length, slower one, clipped down to deep backward square-leg
on the leg and middle again, another two runs to deep backward square-leg. He is shuffling to the off and clipping 'em nicely
this time he will pick up a single with a dab to square-leg
Violent thump! He cleared that front foot and swung it high over long-on. Whack!
High bouncer outside off stump and Kula top edges the pull shot to Hopkins. He tried to fetch it from outside off but was thwarted by the extra bounce. Six down. Now then .. now then..!
banged in short, short-arm pulled to deep square-leg

Drama First almost caught. Then almost run out. In the end, a single results. Rangana checked his defensive push and the ball lobbed close on the on side and Taylor from short midwicket got pretty close to it. He then flicked the ball to the non striker's end where a run out seemed a possibility but Rangana makes a tumbling entry to his crease
works this behind square-leg for a single

Hello! Hello! What is happening out there? They took the Batting Powerplay to go for the Bonus point but have lost wickets in a heap here. Herath tries to flick the off cutter to the on side but gets a leading edge and Taylor holds on to a dolly at short cover
leans forward to defend to the off side
Shot Machang! It was the short-of-length delivery outside off stump and Kapu cuts it through point. Three men in pursuit of it but its the ball boy who gets it
fullish, eased gently towards long-on for a single
the bouncer around the off stump, Kapu allows it pass through to the keeper
short in length, kicks up as it comes in, Kapu tries to work it to the on side for a single but misses. And the ball rolls of the pads.
shortish delivery, pulled away for a single
shuffles across yet again and plays one more of his clip shots past square-leg
short in length around off, tapped to the off for a single
And it's a dot ball. It was short and outside off, Samaraweere tried to steer it through the vacant slip region and makes no contact
slower one, fullish, driven to long-on
full delivery on the middle, flicked past square-leg
slower one, full, driven to mid-off for a single. There is a direct hit at the non-striker's end but the batsman was home
straightens around off stump, stabbed towards covers
Niyamai Niyamai! Samaraweera backs away to force it through covers. Slap! SL win by 3 wickets.
